abstract.text: The Font panel—a user interface object that displays a list of available fonts, letting the user preview them and change the font used to display text.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Actual changes to the font panel are made through conversion messages sent to the shared
instance. There’s only one Font panel for each app.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary to interact with an assistive app.
The complete list of properties and methods for accessible elements.
A set of methods that defines a way to add animation to an existing class with a minimum of API impact.
A set of methods for getting and setting the appearance attributes of a view.
The center of activity for the font-conversion system.
The Font panel—a user interface object that displays a list of available fonts, letting the user preview them and change the font used to display text.
The specified view as the receiver’s accessory view, allowing you to add custom controls to your application’s Font panel without having to create a subclass.
Converts the specified font using the settings in the receiver, with the aid of the shared
if necessary.
A Boolean that shows whether the receiver’s Set button is enabled.
Triggers a reload to the default state, so that the delegate is called.
Sets the selected font in the receiver to the specified font.
Returns the single
instance for the application, creating it if necessary.
Returns
if the shared Font panel has been created,
if it hasn’t.
A Boolean that indicates whether the receiver allows fonts to be changed in modal windows and panels.
A special kind of window that typically performs a function that is auxiliary to the main window.
Methods that responder subclasses implement to support key binding commands, such as inserting tabs and newlines, or moving the insertion point.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
A set of methods used to associate a unique identifier with objects in your user interface.
A protocol that a custom class can adopt to manage the enabled state of a UI element.
A set of methods you use to tell the Font panel to display some or all of its elements.
A false value.
A true value.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
